pageContext.claim: “When I look at what's happened in Texas....When you look at what's happened in Texas with all of those votes that they recently found were not exactly properly done.”
pageContext.analysis: "In an advisory, the Texas secretary of state’s office flagged 95,000 individuals who were not citizens when they obtained a drivers license or ID card to county election administrators. 58,000 of those people previously voted, but it’s unclear whether or not they had obtained citizenship by the time they cast a vote. After all, people are naturalized all the time. Plus, the office cautioned that “all records submitted through this process will need to be treated as WEAK matches,” not firm evidence as Trump suggests.
